version.name: Dear Nobody by Berlie Doherty
version.description: A performance based on a young adult novel that explores the consequences of an unplanned teenage pregnancy. Go toÂ  for more details. $35; students, NS servicemen & senior citizens $30 (www.onetickethub.com and AXS machines)

version.name: Popular Classics
version.description: A performance of Mozarts Don Giovanni overture, Beethovens Triple Concerto (played by violinist Siew Yi Li, cellist Brandon Voo and pianist Beatrice Lin), and Mendelssohns Italian Symphony, with conductor Seah Kar Heng leading the Braddell Heights Symphony Orchestra.

version.name: Play Time @ The Pool
version.description: Join Iggy and friends for fun-filled water games such as tug-of-war. For the less energetic, there will also be arts-and-crafts sessions by the pool.

event.name: SAFRA Singapore Bay Run & Army Half Marathon 2010

version.name: SAFRA Singapore Bay Run & Army Half Marathon 2010
version.description:
Depending on how hardcore you are/want to be, you can choose between the 5, 10 and 21km route through Benjamin Sheares Bridge and Marina Bay. Be entertained by street side performances and an end point carnival. No wonder 70,000 turned up last year.

Call 6337 9835 for enquiries.

version.name: SAFRA Singapore Bay Run
version.description: One of Singapores largest running events with over 70,000 participants and a post-race carnival at The Padang.

event.name: The Coffin is Too Big for the Hole & No Parking on Odd Days

version.name: The Coffin is Too Big for the Hole & No Parking on Odd Days
version.description: This years graduates performs two works by Singapores most famous playwright and theatre pioneer, Kuo Pau Kun.

event.name: A Kuo Pao Kun Double Bill: The Coffin Is Too Big for the Hole/No Parking on Odd Days

version.name: A Kuo Pao Kun Double Bill: The Coffin Is Too Big for the Hole/No Parking on Odd Days
version.description: Conventions provide a humorous look at Singapores straight-edged society. Fight to get out of the box and battle for individuality with Kuo Pau Kuns classic plays that question the notions of self-belief, society and beyond.

version.name: CausewayEXchange
version.description: Over 3,000 performers will be featured at this five-day inaugural festival. In attendance will be Malaysias first lady of theatre (Dato Faridah Merican in Mukabuku), the peninsulas hottest RnB artists (in Serenade Malaysia), a SNL-type show (indicinelive!) and the elder statesmen of comedy in Malaysia Masa Kini. Politics and royalty abound; it seems our neighbours do have a lighter side.

version.name: NAFA Concert Series 10/11: NAFA Orchestra
version.description: Volker Hartung conducts a popular programme of Rossinis Barber of Seville overture, Lehars Gold and Silver Waltz, Gershwins Rhapsody in Blue, with Fillipo Faes on the piano, Rachmaninoffs Vocalize and more.

version.name: Enchanted Harps
version.description:
The harps definitely not your run-of-the-mill instrument like the piano or violin. What made you want to play it?
Y-H: I started playing the piano when I was five, and had always wanted to learn a second instrument. When I was eight, my mother saw an article in the newspaper about the introduction and history of the harp. She thought that maybe I would like to play this beautiful instrument, and it turned out that she was right.
GM: My mother chose the harp for me. I was a very quiet and shy child, so she felt the harp would suit my personality. I was nine years old when I took it up.

How difficult is it to play the harp?
Y-H: For the harp, one needs to coordinate both hands and feet. Playing it not only requires good fingers, you also have seven pedals to control with your feet for changing the accidentals like flats, naturals, and sharps.
GM: There is no such thing as an easy instrument. To be a professional musician you must have complete dedication to your art.

So, are two harps better than one?
GM: Definitely! When two harps play together you get chamber music. Its much more fun to play with someone else and learning to connect with each other musically.
Y-H: We have been playing together for four years now. With two, the music also becomes more colourful and flourishes as we now have four hands to play a lot of notes together.

Tell us about your upcoming concert?
Y-H: We have an exciting programme for this concert featuring music by composers such as [John] Thomas, [Bernard] Andres, [Manuel] de Falla, [Jean-Baptiste] Krumpholz and [Nicolas-Charles] Bochsa. We will perform works specifically written for two harps, [covering] traditions from as far back as the days of Queen Victoria in 1863 to 21st-century French music.

You wont only be playing harp this concert?
Y-H: Yes, there is the Spanish Dance No. 1 from La Vida Breve by Manuel de Falla, which is arranged for two harps and castanets, where I will be kept very busy playing the harp and the castanet at the same time. I have so much fun playing it! Also, we explore contemporary techniques on the harp to create sound effects such as using the tuning key to play the strings, taping the back of the sound board with the tuning key, flicking the strings and playing the strings with the fingernails.

event.name: Under the Banyan Tree: Open-Air Cinema - The Night of the Hunter + Rebel Without A Cause

version.name: Under the Banyan Tree: Open-Air Cinema - The Night of the Hunter + Rebel Without A Cause
version.description:
27 Aug
The Night of the Hunter (1955)
Set in 30s rural America, Charles Laughtons hugely influential creep-out thriller sees Robert Mitchum as the psychopathic preacher with love and hate tattooed on his knuckles in leery pursuit of two children who hold the secret to the whereabouts of a secret stash of money. A brave choice from the National Museum: reward it with your bum on their green.

28 Aug
Rebel Without a Cause (1955)
A brilliant youth film, James Deans finest tells of an unsettled adolescent from a good home who cant keep himself out of trouble.

event.name: Nude Figure Drawing with Tung Yue Nang

version.name: Nude Figure Drawing with Tung Yue Nang
version.description: Senior artist Tung Yue Nang leads this two-day nude figure drawing class comprised of two hours of drawing time in line and outline, followed by a half-hour critique. Attendees must bring their own tools.
